com.github.krlgit.lms

Class Library

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.krlgit.lms.Library

  • public final class Library
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is the heart of the Library Managment System, as it provides the main functionalities of a Library, like

    • registration of Patrons and Books,
    • checking out and reclaiming Books,
    • handling Book requests from Patrons,
    • various queries

    It uses and connects all classes of this package.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int BOOKS_ALLOWED_PER_PATRON
      The max number of Books (10) a Patron can have at the same time.
      static int REQUESTS_FOR_AQUISITION
      The number of requests needed (5), till a new Book gets added to the Libraries shopping list.
      static int REQUESTS_FOR_RESTOCKING
      The number of requests needed (2), till a Book that had previously existing copies in the system gets added to the Libraries shopping list.
      static int TIMES_BORROWED_BEFORE_REMOVAL
      The number of times (50) a Book can be checked out and returned before it is removed from the System due to wear and tear.

    • Method Detail

      • register

        public final Username register(Patron patron)
                        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Adds the specified Patron to this library if he is not already registered. Returns his Username.
        Parameters:
        patron - an unregistered Patron, not null
        Returns:
        the now registered Patrons Username
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if patron.username() is already taken
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if patron is already registered with another username

      • register

        public final Barcode register(BookDescription description)
                       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Adds a Book with the specified BookDescription to this library if a Book with the same Isbn is not already registered. Generates and returns Barcode of the new Book.
        Parameters:
        description - the BookDescription of the Book to be added, not null
        Returns:
        the Barcode generated for the added Book
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if books Isbn is already in system

      • registerAdditionalCopyOf

        public final Barcode registerAdditionalCopyOf(Isbn isbn)
        Add another Copy of a Book that is already registered with the library. Returns the newly generated Barcode for the added Book.
        Parameters:
        isbn - the Isbn number of the Book to be added, not null
        Returns:
        the Barcode generated for the added Book
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if books Isbn is not found in system

      • checkoutBook

        public final boolean checkoutBook(Username username,
                                  Barcode barcode)
                           throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Checks out (borrows) a Book from the Library to a Patron, referenced by it's Barcode and the Patrons Username. A cross reference is created:

        • the Book is added to the Patrons Account
        • the Patron is added to the Books circulationHistory

        Returns true if the checkout succeded and false if the checkout fails, due to the Patrons Account currently holding the max number of Books allowed at the same time (10).

        If a barcode from an already borrowed book is entered, an IllegalStateException is thrown.

        The method changes the state of the Book to isCirculating == true. It can be reversed with returnBook(Barcode).

        Parameters:
        username - the Username of the involved Patron
        barcode - the Barcode of the Book to borrow
        Returns:
        true if Patron is not at BOOKS_ALLOWED_PER_PATRON limit
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if book.isCirculating == true
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the Barcode is not found
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the Username is not found
        See Also:
        returnBook(Barcode)

      • returnBook

        public final boolean returnBook(Barcode barcode)
        "Returns" borrowed Book with specified Barcode to Library (isCirculating=false), or removes it from the system, when TIMES_BORROWED_BEFORE_REMOVAL was reached.

        It is removed from the Patrons Account, but a reference to the Patron is kept in the Books circulationHistory. For Books that get removed from the System by this Method, the number of User requests needed, before the Library reaquires it is REQUESTS_FOR_RESTOCKING (2).

        Parameters:
        barcode - Barcode of the Book to be returned
        Returns:
        true, if Book is returned | false, if Book is removed from system
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if Barcode is not found in system
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if Book isCirculating==false
